description:
'''Reggaeton''' ({{IPAc-en|UK|ˈ|r|ɛ|ɡ|eɪ|t|oʊ|n|,_|ˌ|r|ɛ|ɡ|eɪ|ˈ|t|ɒ|n}}, {{IPAc-en|US|ˌ|r|ɛ|ɡ|eɪ|ˈ|t|oʊ|n|,_|ˌ|r|eɪ|ɡ|-}}) is a style of [[popular music|popular]] and [[electronic music]] that originated in [[Panamanian reggaetón|Panama]] during the late 1980s. It has been popularized and dominated by artists from [[Puerto Rico]] since the early 1990s.

It has evolved from [[dancehall]], with elements of [[Hip hop music|hip hop]], [[Latin American music|Latin American]], and [[Caribbean music]]. Vocals include [[Toasting (Jamaican music)|toasting]]/[[rapping]] and singing, typically in Spanish. Reggaeton is regarded as one of the most popular music genres in the [[Caribbean Spanish|Spanish-speaking Caribbean]]. By the 2010s, the genre had seen increased popularity across Latin America, as well as acceptance within mainstream Western music.
